availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Frost (Hopkins County farmer and member of 25th and 17th Kentucky Infantry)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer and soldier. Lived in Hopkins County, Kentucky in 1860. Lived with parents, John B and Mary Frost, who owned thirteen enslaved persons in 1860. Served as a private in the 25th Kentucky Infantry (Co. D) from October 1861 to December 1861. The 25th consolidated into the 17th Kentucky Infantry. Promoted to corporeal of the 17th Kentucky Infantry (Co. E) and served from December 1861 to April 1862. Promoted to Sergeant and served from April 1862 to November 1862. Promoted to sergeant major and served from November 1862 to December 1862. Promoted to second lieutenant and served from December 1862 to August 1863. Promoted to first lieutenant, and transferred to Co. G, and served from August 1863 to September 1864. Promoted to captain and served from September 1864 to January 1865.

bibl.p: John H. Frost, 17th Kentucky Infantry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/272/230533759) (accessed on March 22, 2017); Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 940-944, 958-959, and 966-967; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 239-240; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 1; "John H. Frost," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=63440690&ref=acom) (accessed on March 22, 2017).
